description.narrative: School-based management, action and monitoring is mainstreamed and operationalized in selected governorates, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, children of basic and post-basic school age, especially girls, have increased and more equitable access to quality learning in a progressively strengthened education system, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: School-based management, action and monitoring is mainstreamed and operationalized in selected governorates

description.narrative: As of October, 123,234 children (50,148 girls) in 306 schools benefited from the implementation of the School Based Management (SBM) approach. More than 900 teachers and 300 Parents and Teacher Association (PTA) chairs received training on planning, budgeting and implementation of School Improvement Plans (SIPs) and are now able to exercise financial and administrative authorities and to enhance the role of parents and communities in improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the education system. Cumulatively a total of 1,463 schools have a functioning School Based Management approach in line with national policy. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2018
